info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:48AM CDT until August 12 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT FOR PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS... EAST CENTRAL RALLS AND CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI... At 146 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Payson to 8 miles southwest of Barry to near Spencerburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 120, a large tree was reported down in Palmyra. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bowling Green, Pittsfield, Louisiana, Barry, Griggsville, Payson, Pleasant Hill, Atlas, Clarksville, Beverly, Frankford, Pike, Tarrants, Spencerburg, Kingston, Independence, Hull, Martinsburg, Richfield, and Perry. This includes Interstate 72 between exits 10 and 35. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
